Description: Proposed that the Atlantis story was inspired by the eruption of Thera in ca. 1600 BCE
Claimed identification of man-made buildings using sonar appoximately 1,500 meters below surface off the coast of Cyprus
Other references:
https://web.archive.org/web/20070912120429/http://www.discoveryofatlantis.com/ 
Sarmast, R., 2006, Discovery of Atlantis: The Startling Case for the Island of Cyprus. Origin Press, San Rafael, California. 195 pp.

Description: The Atlantis story was proposed to be inspired the destruction of Helike by an earthquake and tsunami in 373 BCE
Other references: Giovannini, A. (1985). "Peut-on démythifier l'Atlantide?". Museum Helveticum (in French). 42: 151–156.

Description: In his 1882 book Atlantis: the Antediluvian World, Ignatius L. Donnelly mapped the flooded continent of Atlantis as being located in the Atlantis Ocean opposed to the Mediterranean Sea possibly near the present day Azores Islands
Claims Antarctica was habitable with in the last 10,000 years and home to Atlantis, but that earths crust shifted (Earth Crustal Displacement Theory) resulting in its destruction
Other references: Hancock, Graham Fingerprints of the Gods

Description: Atlantis is a submerged island whose reminant plateaus form Sardinia and Corsica
Other references: Usai, Luigi (2021). La mappa di Atlantide. Quartucciu, Sardinia

Description: Megalithic structures in Malta have been claimed to be remenant of Atlantis
Snake Island has been proposed as the former capital of Atlantis based on its position relative to the Danube Delta in the Black Sea
Several researchers have claimed Atlantis lied in or near Donana National Park and the Guadalquivir River
Now submerged under 50+m of waters, some have proposed the Spartel Bank just west of the Straight of Gibraltar as the mythical location of Atlantis
The concentric structure of the Richat Structure has lead some to claim it is the remenant of the circular city layout described by Plato in the Atlantis myth
One researcher claims Atlantis was located on an now submerged plateau located off the coast of Northern Spain
Atlantis was located on a large island in the Irish Sea that was claimed to be innundated after a comet impact that shifted the Earth's pole around 5000 years ago
Others claim Ireland was the location of Atlantis, particularly in connection to the Megalithic tombs found dating to the Neolithic
Some claim Atlantis was located in Doggerland, a portion of the North Sea that was flooded after the end of the last Ice Age
